result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Adent makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  #2.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with victim.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Parenting class
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing at 02-25-2016 10:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-01-2016 08:30 am

Case called to continue the motion to suppress statement of the defendant.  Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the DVD entirely.  Matthew Harper sworn in, testified.  Tammy Lynn Mieritz sworn in, testified.   Attorney Adent moves for a short recess.  Court reconvenes, Attorney Juech objects to the witness being involved with discussions.  Court will exclude the witness from discussions.  Jeffrey F. Mieritz sworn in, testified. Testimony closed.  Parties give closing arguments. Court finds there was no custody at the time.  Court denies the motion at this time.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
DVD Stored in the exhibit room until 02/26/2036
Motion hearing at 01-07-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Exhibit #1 marked. Office Harper is sworn-in and testifies for the State. Exhibit #1 played for questioning of the witness. Attorney Adent requests that the Court review the entire DVD before making a decision. Exhibit #1 admitted into evidence. Court will adjourn for DVD to be viewed. Continued Motion hearing to be scheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing at 11-16-2015 03:00 pm
to suppress statement of the defendant

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion filed in Court.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 10-01-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters plea of NOT GUILTY.  Attorney Adent advises he will be filing motions.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Village of Hartland Police Officer Matthew Harper sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Juech.  Cross examination by Attorney Adent.  State rests.  Closing statements.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Attorney Adent requests video recordings be provided from the State.  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court with attorney Leonard G. Adent.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested and the time limits are waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim and not to discuss this case with her.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Jeffrey F Mieritz in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
